document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of genus Deferunda Distant (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Achilidae) from southwest China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of genus Deferunda Distant (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Achilidae) from southwest China

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of the genus
Deferunda
of the world

paragraph.keyLead:
2 ( 1 ) Hind tibiae without lateral spine (
Distant 1912
) .....................................................................
D. stigmatica Distant

3 ( 2 ) Anterior margin of vertex truncate (
Chen et al., 1989
: Fig. 28 : A); apical third of forewing without milky-white spots (
Chen et al., 1989
: Fig. 28 : D)
................................................................... D. truncata
Chen, Yang & Wilson

4 ( 3 ) Vertex subequal to pronotum in middle line (Melichar 1914 ) ...........................................
D. philippina (Melichar)

5 ( 4 ) Lateral margins of frons without narrow dark stripes (
Fig. 2
).......................................................
D. diana
sp. nov.

6 ( 5 ) Vertex relatively short, as long in middle line as broad at base, median carina bordered with short longitudinal black stripes apically (
Matsumura 1914
) ............................................................................
D. lineola (Matsumura)

- Vertex relatively long, longer in median line than broad at base, median carina bordered with longitudinal dark stripes from apex to base (
Matsumura 1914
:
Fig. 5
: a;
Chou & Wang 1985
: Fig. 28 : a;
Chen et al. 1989
: Fig. 27 : A) ............................................................................................................................................................................. 7

- Forewing with Cu 1 a straight or slightly convex distad of clavus, not reaching M ( Figs 3 , 15 ;
Chou & Wang 1985
: Fig. 28 : a) ....................................................................................................................
D. acuminata Chou & Wang

9 ( 8 ) Lateral margins of frons with five narrow dark brown stripes (
Wang et al. 2008
:
Fig. 1
); forewing with costal margin red, apical region having three red triangular markings (
Wang et al. 2008
: Figs 2 , 18 ) .....................................
..................................................................................................................................... D. trimaculata
Wang & Peng

11 ( 10 ) Body relatively small, body length including forewing 3 4.5mm , Ƥ 4.7mm ; pygofer with mediaoventral processes diverging apically (
Dlabola 1961 : Fig. 32
) ....................................................................
D. incompta Dlabola
